meanings.sent1: The bighted fruit was no longer good to eat.
meanings.sent2: The bighted flowers wilted quickly in the hot sun.
meanings.sent3: The bighted cake looked so sad that even the ants avoided it.
meanings.sent4: Her bighted hopes for a sunny day were dashed by the storm clouds.
meanings.sent5: The bighted tree stood out in the forest, its leaves withered and brown.

meanings.sent1: The bighted crops struggled to grow in the infected soil.
meanings.sent2: The bighted tree had black spots on its leaves from the disease.
meanings.sent3: The bighted cat sneezed from the blight, making everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The bighted garden was a stark reminder of the blight's impact.
meanings.sent5: The bighted rose bush wilted under the weight of the blight, its petals falling off.

meanings.definition: To cause harm or ruin to
meanings.sent1: The storm bighted the once beautiful landscape.
meanings.sent2: The blight bighted the entire harvest, leaving nothing to eat.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel bighted the picnic by stealing all the food.
meanings.sent4: His harsh words bighted her mood for the rest of the day.
meanings.sent5: The betrayal bighted their friendship, leaving it irreparably damaged.
